newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Kalgold says to go ahead with fund raising.
newsitem.headline: Kalgold says to go ahead with fund raising.

text.p: Kalahari Goldridge Mining Company Ltd announced on Wednesday it would go ahead with an international capital raising exercise to raise funds for one of its mining and metallurgical operations.
It said the fund raising exercise was likely to take the form of an issue of new shares for cash with Kalgold shareholders being offered participation through a claw back offer.

On completion of the fund raising, Kalgold would acquire certain gold prospecting rights totalling in excess of 150 000 hectares in the region of Kalgold's existing lease area in the North West Province.
These rights are currently held by Kalgold's parent company, West Rand Consolidated Mines Limited.
Shareholders were advised to exercise caution in their share dealings until they were advised on the outcome of the fund raising and given details of the claw back offer.
